content: Atkinson is a surname of English origin. The name is derived from the personal name "Atkin," which is a diminutive form of the name "Adam." The surname Atkinson means "son of Atkin" or "son of Adam." The name was first recorded in the 13th century in England, and it was commonly used as a personal name as well as a surname. The surname Atkinson is most commonly found in the United Kingdom and in countries with significant English diaspora populations, such as the United States, Canada, and Australia. It has been borne by several notable individuals throughout history, including writers, actors, and musicians.
